intro: Wilczekra gabonica, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, hairy fruits that contain several seeds. Wilczekra gabonica is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
